comment: Removing "five" from the first sentence, changing "branches" to "areas" in the second one

diff.*:
Line 1: Line 1:  
{{otheruses}}
 
{{otheruses}}
−
'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''ethikos''", meaning "theory of living") is one of the five major branches of [[philosophy]], one that covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept|concepts]] such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary branches: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of what ethicality is), ''normative ethics'' (the study of how ethical truths are known), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical knowledge).
+
'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''ethikos''", meaning "theory of living") is one of the major branches of [[philosophy]], one that covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept|concepts]] such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary areas: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of what ethicality is), ''normative ethics'' (the study of how ethical truths are known), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical knowledge).
     
==Meta-ethics==
 
==Meta-ethics==
